issue.title: Uncaught error when connecting Bluetooth controllers
issue.body:
In [Ludo](https://github.com/libretro/ludo), there's a breaking exception that's thrown from `glfw` when connecting a Bluetooth controller:

```
GLFW: An uncaught error has occurred: InvalidValue: Invalid button in gamepad mapping 050000005e040000fd02000003090000 (Xbox One Wireless Controller)
GLFW: Please report this bug in the Go package immediately.
GLFW: An uncaught error has occurred: InvalidValue: Invalid button in gamepad mapping 050000005e040000fd02000003090000 (Xbox One Wireless Controller)
GLFW: Please report this bug in the Go package immediately.
GLFW: An uncaught error has occurred: InvalidValue: Invalid button in gamepad mapping 050000005e040000fd02000003090000 (Xbox One Wireless Controller)
GLFW: Please report this bug in the Go package immediately.
GLFW: An uncaught error has occurred: InvalidValue: Invalid button in gamepad mapping 050000005e040000fd02000003090000 (Xbox One Wireless Controller)
GLFW: Please report this bug in the Go package immediately.
GLFW: An uncaught error has occurred: InvalidValue: Invalid button in gamepad mapping 050000005e040000fd02000003090000 (Xbox One Wireless Controller)
GLFW: Please report this bug in the Go package immediately.
GLFW: An uncaught error has occurred: InvalidValue: Invalid button in gamepad mapping 050000005e040000fd02000003090000 (Xbox One Wireless Controller)
GLFW: Please report this bug in the Go package immediately.
GLFW: An uncaught error has occurred: InvalidValue: Invalid button in gamepad mapping 050000005e040000fd02000003090000 (Xbox One Wireless Controller)
GLFW: Please report this bug in the Go package immediately.
GLFW: An uncaught error has occurred: InvalidValue: Invalid button in gamepad mapping 050000005e040000fd02000003090000 (Xbox One Wireless Controller)
GLFW: Please report this bug in the Go package immediately.
GLFW: An uncaught error has occurred: InvalidValue: Invalid button in gamepad mapping 050000005e040000fd02000003090000 (Xbox One Wireless Controller)
GLFW: Please report this bug in the Go package immediately.
GLFW: An uncaught error has occurred: InvalidValue: Invalid button in gamepad mapping 050000005e040000fd02000003090000 (Xbox One Wireless Controller)
GLFW: Please report this bug in the Go package immediately.
GLFW: An uncaught error has occurred: InvalidValue: Invalid button in gamepad mapping 050000005e040000fd02000003090000 (Xbox One Wireless Controller)
GLFW: Please report this bug in the Go package immediately.
GLFW: An uncaught error has occurred: InvalidValue: Invalid button in gamepad mapping 050000005e040000fd02000003090000 (Xbox One Wireless Controller)
GLFW: Please report this bug in the Go package immediately.
GLFW: An uncaught error has occurred: InvalidValue: Invalid button in gamepad mapping 050000005e040000fd02000003090000 (Xbox One Wireless Controller)
GLFW: Please report this bug in the Go package immediately.
GLFW: An uncaught error has occurred: InvalidValue: Invalid button in gamepad mapping 050000005e040000fd02000003090000 (Xbox One Wireless Controller)
GLFW: Please report this bug in the Go package immediately.
GLFW: An uncaught error has occurred: InvalidValue: Invalid button in gamepad mapping 050000005e040000fd02000003090000 (Xbox One Wireless Controller)
GLFW: Please report this bug in the Go package immediately.

GLFW: Please report this bug in the Go package immediately.
GLFW: An uncaught error has occurred: InvalidValue: Invalid button in gamepad mapping 050000005e040000fd02000003090000 (Xbox One Wireless Controller)
GLFW: Please report this bug in the Go package immediately.
GLFW: An uncaught error has occurred: InvalidValue: Invalid button in gamepad mapping 050000005e040000fd02000003090000 (Xbox One Wireless Controller)
GLFW: Please report this bug in the Go package immediately.
GLFW: An uncaught error has occurred: InvalidValue: Invalid button in gamepad mapping 050000005e040000fd02000003090000 (Xbox One Wireless Controller)
GLFW: Please report this bug in the Go package immediately.
GLFW: An uncaught error has occurred: InvalidValue: Invalid button in gamepad mapping 050000005e040000fd02000003090000 (Xbox One Wireless Controller)
GLFW: Please report this bug in the Go package immediately.
GLFW: An uncaught error has occurred: InvalidValue: Invalid button in gamepad mapping 050000005e040000fd02000003090000 (Xbox One Wireless Controller)
GLFW: Please report this bug in the Go package immediately.
GLFW: An uncaught error has occurred: InvalidValue: Invalid button in gamepad mapping 050000005e040000fd02000003090000 (Xbox One Wireless Controller)
GLFW: Please report this bug in the Go package immediately.
panic: InvalidValue: Invalid button in gamepad mapping 050000005e040000fd02000003090000 (Xbox One Wireless Controller)

goroutine 1 [running, locked to thread]:
github.com/go-gl/glfw/v3.3/glfw.acceptError(0xc000107e60, 0x1, 0x1, 0x85ed00, 0x0)
	/home/travis/gopath/pkg/mod/github.com/go-gl/glfw/v3.3/glfw@v0.0.0-20200222043503-6f7a984d4dc4/error.go:174 +0x216
github.com/go-gl/glfw/v3.3/glfw.Init(0xc0000ae6c0, 0xc0000901b0)
	/home/travis/gopath/pkg/mod/github.com/go-gl/glfw/v3.3/glfw@v0.0.0-20200222043503-6f7a984d4dc4/glfw.go:37 +0x4e
main.main()
	/home/travis/gopath/src/github.com/libretro/ludo/main.go:85 +0x2f4
```

This is directly tied to libretro/ludo/issues/342

This has been confirmed with two 8BitDo controllers (the [Lite](https://www.8bitdo.com/lite/) and the [SN30 Pro in X-Input mode](https://support.8bitdo.com/)) and an Xbox One Bluetooth controller.

Additionally, it seems to be specific to version 3.3, according to the original issue (342, linked above).

issue.title: Game crashes at startup on macos 10.11 [Minecraft 1.16.1]

repository.name: Controllable
repository.description: Adds in the ability to use a controller to play Minecraft Java Edition

issue.body: Whenever I connect my xbox one controller the game crashes in the middle of startup.

issue.title: When I connect Xbox Wireless Controller to Mac the game crashes.

repository.name: Controllable
repository.description: Adds in the ability to use a controller to play Minecraft Java Edition

issue.body:
There is some error that pops-up when I connect my controller to my Mac with bluetooth. Keep in mind that while the controller is not connected the game starts together with the mod with no issues.

The game crashed whilst initializing game
Error: java.lang.IllegalStateException: GLFW error before init: [0x10004]Invalid button in gamepad mapping 030000005e040000fd02000003090000 (Xbox Wireless Controller)
Exit Code: 255

Attaching the full crash report:
[crash-2021-02-27_11.24.39-client.txt](https://github.com/MrCrayfish/Controllable/files/6054101/crash-2021-02-27_11.24.39-client.txt)

issue.title: Immediate crash when running gamepad example locally

repository.name: ebiten
repository.description: A dead simple 2D game engine for Go

issue.body:
I'm running Void Linux. I copied the code for the gamepad example and removed the ```// +build example jsgo```. It compiles, but upon running it immediately crashes.

issue.title: Launcher doesn't start when a Teensy is connected

repository.name: gslauncher
repository.description: Repository for the GrooveStats Launcher for the Simply Love SM5 theme.

issue.body:
I'm on Xubuntu 64-bit. With my Teensy connected, the launcher fails to boot reporting some invalid gamepad mappings. I'm not sure if this should be fixed in the launcher or in my FSR code, but it doesn't seem problematic elsewhere so I'm wondering what causes this exception on the launcher side.

```
2021/05/10 20:02:30 GrooveStats Launcher 1.0.0 (linux amd64)
GLFW: An uncaught error has occurred: InvalidValue: Invalid button in gamepad mapping 03000000c01600008704000011010000 (Serial/Keyboard/Mouse/Joystick)
GLFW: Please report this bug in the Go package immediately.
```

issue.title: Bug: PS4 Controller support in LudOS

repository.name: ludo
repository.description: A libretro frontend written in golang

issue.body:
I updated to the latest LudOS on Pi3b+ and was using a PS4 Controller Wired, now the controller does not work. I attached an image below it looks like it detects as a wireless controller now and also detects the touchpad on the PS4 controller. This is the message I get
![2019-10-23 13-23-09-1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1812594/67418232-6895e980-f598-11e9-9c2e-5e45144a7ff3.JPG)

body:
> I'm reporting this here to understand if this is a problem in GLFW 3.3.2 or if it's a problem in how the go-gl GLFW bindings use it.

This is on GLFW, not go-gl. `glfwInit` should definitely not be spamming `GLFW_INVALID_VALUE`. There are several levels of fail in the gamepad mapping logic. I've removed the error message for now and am working on proper fixes that will let us use the full upstream database unmodified again.

issue.title: Better controller support on linux is needed

repository.name: Ikemen-GO
repository.description: An open-source fighting game engine that supports MUGEN resources.

issue.body:
I'm using Arch Linux, and been having problems with setting up Ikemen-Go to use my DS4 controller.
First of all, I can't change the controller configuration through the in-game joystick config GUI as it doesn't capture any input from my controller, making me unable to edit it.
To fix this, I had to use `jstest` to get the ID number of each button and then manually map it to the config.json file. This also had problems since I couldn't figure out the ID numbers for the joystick and the D-Pad as they're axis, not buttons. Strangely enough the only movement I could get was moving left, by pressing Up on the D-Pad.
Then I decided to just add the game to my steam library as a non-steam game and use its built-in controller remapping, mapping each button and axis to a keyboard key.
This works, but it's not perfect nor optimal.

issue.title: Can we apply the gamepad issue fix before 3.3.5 is released?
issue.body:
Now GLFW 3.3 has an issue that specific gamepads crashes the app immediately, and this will be fixed in 3.3.5 (https://github.com/glfw/glfw/issues/1763). This is a pretty serious problem in my library that uses GLFW (e.g. https://github.com/hajimehoshi/ebiten/issues/1229). As we're not sure when 3.3.5 is released, would it be possible to apply the patch before 3.3.5 is released?

CC @dmitshur

body:
Thank you for fixing this!

Does the same issue happen on SDL? If not, does GLFW have different joystick table than SDL's or some logics?

SDL did have the same issue but has since resolved it. Looking into exactly how is part of the work I mentioned above.

We have the same data tables as SDL, via the SDL_GameControllerDB project, but we are currently stuck on an older version of it.

Thank you!

We found that the same issue can happen not only at `glfwInit` but also at `glfwPollEvents`. I'd be happy if you could update `glfwPollEvents` too.

https://github.com/hajimehoshi/ebiten/issues/1229#issuecomment-880030199 (This is an error log by a Go wrapper of GLFW)

EDIT: And maybe `glfwWaitEvents` and `glfwWaitEventsTimeout` should also be fixed?

@hajimehoshi Those should all have been fixed by the commit above as they all in the end call that same function (`findValidMapping`). I do want the error to be completely gone, so if I've somehow missed it I'll gladly fix it but I can't currently see how it would still be happening.

issue.title: Remove workaround for bug that was fixed in GLFW 3.3.5
issue.body:
Disclaimer: I don't personally have any joysticks to verify this with but the upstream issue has been resolved.

Updates https://github.com/go-gl/glfw/issues/324 and https://github.com/glfw/glfw/issues/1763
